html:
therefore will the Lord wait. The Hebrew reading of this verse indicates that the Lord is waiting to be gracious and show mercy on Israel, but his blessings must wait until justice has been served.

therefore will he be exalted. This phrase should more properly read "therefore will he rise."

blessed are all they that wait for him. Note the reciprocal relationship shown in the double usage of the verb wait in this verse: The Lord waits (longs) to be gracious to the righteous, and those who wait, or long, for the Lord, will be blessed.
